documentType: last will and testament with codicils
summary: This document is Jeffrey Epstein's last will and testament, originally dated December 11, 2001, and five subsequent codicils (amendments) dated through 2007. It details the appointment and changes to his executors, the disposition of his estate to a trust, and extensive powers granted to the executors. The document is significant for revealing the individuals Epstein trusted to manage his estate and the substantial compensation he allocated to them.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's entire estate was bequeathed to 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One,' a trust he created on November 8, 2001.
The executors of the will were changed multiple times between 2001 and 2007, ultimately settling on Henry Jarecki, James Cayne, and Lawrence Newman, with Darren K. Indyke as successor.
Executor compensation was increased from $100,000 each in the original will to $250,000 in 2004, and finally to $500,000 each in 2007.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the trust.
The executors were granted extremely broad and discretionary powers over the estate's assets, including the authority to invest without restriction, operate businesses, and avoid court supervision.
